content.description:
Decent route for the amount of loose conglomerate. Several problems can be found, but only a few could manage the amount of force exerted by a person's weight (especially when you include smaller crimps). Larger moves and hand-holds are king, these larger features should hold up well. 

 Best you go at low-tide to avoid a wet landing.
content.protection: Pad, healthy ankles if falling on sand.
content.location: Start above the barnacle line, as these will slough off with minimal traction. Start on the large, low volume under and left of the overhang facing east. Standing start.

content.description: This standalone spire sits proudly in the middle of the beach, just distant to West Orford Street. While the rock is a chossy delight, many of the larger features are planted firmly into the conglomerate making it ideal for those fun, big moves.
